Sentencas: The present study is devoted to the fabrication of an anode supported microtubular solid oxide fuel cell (MTSOFC) by co -sintering of polymer -ceramic films set.
Titulo: Co-sintering of gradient anode - electrolyte structure for microtubular SOFC

Sentencas: The investigation of the influence of the granulometric composition of Zr0.84Y0.16O2-delta (YSZ), Ce0.73Gd0.27O2-delta (GDC) powders and NiO/YSZ, NiO/GDC composites on the kinetics of their sintering made it possible to obtain a defect -free half -cell of anode supporting layer (NiO/YSZ)anode functional layer (NiO/GDC) - YSZ electrolyte in a single sintering act at 1200 degrees C.
Titulo: Co-sintering of gradient anode - electrolyte structure for microtubular SOFC

Sentencas: The influence of a pore former (rice starch) on the microstructure of the anode supporting layer was studied.
Titulo: Co-sintering of gradient anode - electrolyte structure for microtubular SOFC

Sentencas: It was shown that the addition of 5 wt% pore former results in an increase of the porosity and gas permeability of the layer by -1.6 and -4 times, respectively.
Titulo: Co-sintering of gradient anode - electrolyte structure for microtubular SOFC

Sentencas: Layers of the second GDC electrolyte and La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-delta (LSCF) cathode were applied sequentially by dip -coating and painting and were sintering at 1450 and 1200 degrees C, respectively.
Titulo: Co-sintering of gradient anode - electrolyte structure for microtubular SOFC

Sentencas: The maximum specific power of the obtained MT-SOFC at 850 degrees C was 184 mW/cm2.
Titulo: Co-sintering of gradient anode - electrolyte structure for microtubular SOFC
